Package Controller

Class AppointmentController

java.lang.Object
Controller.AppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddAppointmentController, ModifyAppointmentController
public class AppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Generic controller for adding and modifying appoinments

  • Field Details

    • titleLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label titleLabel
      The label for the text field where the user enters the Title of the Appointment. eg. "Planning Meeting"

    • titleTextField

      protected javafx.scene.control.TextField titleTextField
      The text field where the user enters the Title of the Appointment eg. "Planning Meeting"

    • descriptionLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label descriptionLabel
      The label for the text field where the user will enter the description for the Appointment. eg. "We will do planning at this meeting for the Holiday Event"

    • descriptionTextField

      protected javafx.scene.control.TextField descriptionTextField
      The text field where the user will enter the description for the Appointment. eg. "We will do planning at this meeting for the Holiday Event"

    • locationLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label locationLabel
      The label for the text field where the user will enter the description for the Appointment. eg. "Room 241"

    • locationTextField

      protected javafx.scene.control.TextField locationTextField
      The text field where the user will enter the description for the Appointment. eg. "Room 241"

    • typeLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label typeLabel
      The label for the text field where the user will enter the type for the appointment.

    • typeTextField

      protected javafx.scene.control.TextField typeTextField
      The text field where the user will enter the type for the appointment. eg. "Interview", "Meeting", "Dinner" etc.

    • localTimeLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label localTimeLabel
      Shows the current time in the time zone the user is in. The user will see Eastern time as well to the right of this label, and this serves to remind the user that the appointment being made will be tested to see if it fits within the offices hours of 8am-10pm in the Eastern Time zone. Since most people don't memorize the time zone differences in their head, these labels will serve as a reminder to help them set good appointment times.

    • easternTimeLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label easternTimeLabel
      Shows the current time in Eastern time. The user will see their own local time as well to the left of this label, and this serves to remind the user that the appointment being made will be tested to see if it fits within the offices hours of 8am-10pm in the Eastern Time zone. Since most people don't memorize the time zone differences in their head, these labels will serve as a reminder to help them set good appointment times.

    • startLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label startLabel
      A label next to the calendar widget the user will use to the set the start time for the appointment they are creating. It is simply labelled "start" and should prompt the user to start thinking about when their appointment should start.

    • startDatePicker

      protected javafx.scene.control.DatePicker startDatePicker
      A calendar widget that allows the user select the day, month, and year ie. the date that they want their appointment to start on.

    • startHourComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox startHourComboBox
      A ComboBox that allows the user to select the hour they want their appointment to start on.

    • startMinuteComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox startMinuteComboBox
      A ComboBox that allows the user to select which minute they want their appointment to start on. The options are [0, 15, 30, 45] for convenience. The minimum appointment duration is 15 minutes. It is assumed no users are going to want to create an appointment that is 1 minute long for example.

    • startAMPMComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox startAMPMComboBox
      A ComboBox that allows the user to select "AM" or "PM" for the Appointment start time of the appointment they are creating. A selection of Hour of 12 with selection "AM" would result in an appointment that starts at midnight, A selection of Hour of 12 with selection "PM" would result in an appointment that starts at noon.

    • endLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label endLabel
      A label next to the calendar widget the user will use to the set the end time for the appointment they are creating. It is simply labelled "end" and should prompt the user to start thinking about when their appointment should end.

    • endDatePicker

      protected javafx.scene.control.DatePicker endDatePicker
      A calendar widget that allows the user select the day, month, and year ie. the date that they want their appointment to end on.

    • endHourComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox endHourComboBox
      A ComboBox that allows the user to select the hour they want their appointment to end on.

    • endMinuteComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox endMinuteComboBox
      A ComboBox that allows the user to select which minute they want their appointment to end on. The options are [0, 15, 30, 45] for convenience. The minimum appointment duration is 15 minutes. It is assumed no users are going to want to create an appointment that is 1 minute long for example.

    • endAMPMComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox endAMPMComboBox
      A ComboBox that allows the user to select "AM" or "PM" for the Appointment end time of the appointment they are creating. A selection of Hour of 12 with selection "AM" would result in an appointment that ends at midnight, A selection of Hour of 12 with selection "PM" would result in an appointment that ends at noon.

    • customerIdLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label customerIdLabel
      All label indicating that the ComboBox below it will be used to the select the Customer by ID that will be present at the Appointment being created.

    • customerIdComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox customerIdComboBox
      A ComboBox used to the select the Customer that will be present at the appointment being created.

    • userIdLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label userIdLabel
      A label indicating that the ComboBox below it will be used to select the User associated with the Appointment being created by user id.

    • userIdComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox userIdComboBox
      A ComboBox the user will use to select the User associated with the Appointment by user id. This ComboBox is populated with the set of all users available in the database. The ComboBox displays in each row first the user id and then the string for the User_Name. eg. "1: Sally"

    • contactIdLabel

      protected javafx.scene.control.Label contactIdLabel
      A label indicating that the ComboBox below it will be used to the select the Contact associated with the Appointment being created by the Contact Id.

    • contactIdComboBox

      protected javafx.scene.control.ComboBox contactIdComboBox
      A ComboBox that the user will use to select the Contact that will be associated with the Appointment being created.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onOkButton

      public boolean onOkButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException, SQLException
      This function runs when the user clicks the OK button in the modify-appointment.fxml view to indicate that they are done editing the appointment, and they would like it added to the database now. This function runs many checks on the data entered by the user into various fields and will display an appropriate warning if needed. For example, the database is checked to make sure that the appointment the user is trying to create does not overlap with any other appointments already created in the database. This is called Collision Detection. The function will not insert into the database any appointments or edits that create collisions and will show red text above any text fields and combo boxes that need to be corrected by the user.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - not used
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating if the input in all widgets entered by the user was valid
      Throws:
      IOException - - called if ComboBoxes being checked contain an invalid string
      SQLException - - called on poorly formed sql or bad results returned from the database

    • onCancelButton

      public void onCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function runs when the user selects the cancel button in the modify-appointment.fxml view. This function will return the user to the main view in main.fxml and no appointments or appointment edits will be added to the database.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - not used
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws an exception if main.fxml cannot be found or loaded
